topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Preparing for Offline or Pre-Downloaded Installation

body.p: If downloading directly to the Deployer is not an option for security or other reasons, you can pre-download the installation packages for use during installation.
The pre-download also eliminates the possibility of connection interruptions during installation.

ol.li: Using your preferred Web browser, navigate to the HPE Helion Download Network (HDN) and log in. If necessary, create an account first.

For each service:
Locate the service to download.
Click the blue download button at the top right of the screen to download the package to your local machine.
If you did not download directly to the HPE Helion OpenStack deployer, copy all the downloaded packages to a USB stick or external hard drive.
Insert the USB stick or external hard drive into physical machine hosting the HPE Helion OpenStack Deployer and copy the installation. Make sure there is enough space; the file sizes can be significant.

Follow the installation instructions provided for each service.When installing pre-downloaded files, make sure you copy the files to the local directory that you are running the installer from. If the installer cannot find a file with the name you provided in the local directory, it will attempt to download the files again.
